Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdgeMY
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay for this hotel, you shouldn't complain much at all. It seems like a refurbished 2/3 star hotel. I would stay here again because 1) Location is good - MRT station is a 7 minute walk 2) Food Court across road is 24/7 as well as the 7-11 convenience store 3) Price is reasonable by Singapore standards WiFi is not free tho :)

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Marjory1
Reviews.Content: A great choice for a short stay in Singapore. The hotel is small but it is a great central location and just 10 minutes walk to Orchard Road. Our room was quite small but for one night it was fine. Breakfast was OK but nothing exciting! Would certainly stay here again for a one or maybe two night stay. The small pool was great for a refreshing dip after sightseeing. There is also a small fitness room too. Major construction works were in the street (new metro) but these did not cause us any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: Singapore is an expensive place to visit and you want to position your stay near the attractions so this small hotel is great value. Small (not tiny) comfortable, spotless rooms. Fantastic position, 10 min walk to Orchard Rd and MRT. At $S150 including breakfast a couple its perhaps half what you'll pay in a bigger hotel. As independent, mature, travelers would happily stay on any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice area”
Reviews.Author: makusu
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was not that great. The reception area is small, but the rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nothing much, it was the same everyday. And the staff at the restaurant were unfriendly. However, it was a safe, we had a late evening flight, so we checked out and left our bags, so we had no issues. The area is safe, we walked about in the night and felt very safe. There's a bus stand and bras barah metro station just 5mins walk. The best part was the the 24hour open food court very close to the hotel and also a 7 eleven. I went in Dec 2011 and at that time there was some construction going on so some the main road outside the hotel was closed, so the taxis have to take a detour. But it didn't cause too much inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Booked by mistake, and oh did I regret it”
Reviews.Author: trippingLondon
Reviews.Content: I had a bizarre booking error on hotels.com where apparently somehow I managed to book this hotel instead of the intended Ibis Bencoolen. I very much regretted the experience: very small, unclean, cramped room, paper thin walls and gormless staff. Suffice to say we checked out the next morning even though I lost the cost of the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average budget hotel for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: Probably it's biggest draw is it's well placed, relatively central location. Very convenient links to public transport and/or taxis. Simple rooms, bathroom was a bit dirty and outdated. Room has a 'dusty' feel to it. Next time I would pay more and get a better place. Rate it as average for Singapore (as hotels are generally more expensive for equivalent than other major cities), but I would probably rate it one lower at 'poor' in other cities (ex. KL, Manila, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Domainworks
Reviews.Content: Good location near Bus stops, Bugis Market. Not welcoming Front Desk Personnels. Clean small standard room, you can hear the noise from another room. Slow Wi-Fi internet connection. Few food selection in breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Bad FD”
Reviews.Author: orange_clouds
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good things. 1) Location is okay and is walking distance from two subway lines. The hotel is also near the art district of Singapore which is awesome. It's quite a happening place as little bars here and there come alive at night. 2) Good elevators and dozens of helpful maps can be found in the lobby. There's also an update of airplane schedules which is very helpful, i must say. 3) Wi-Fi can be accessed at hi-speed throughout the building upon request of password at front desk. 4) Rooms and lobby are very clean 5) Friendly kitchen and bellman really made our stay quite bearable 6) Manager is very accommodating and always had a smile upon her face. The bad part: FRONT DESK STAFF Before I even arrived there FD, the two women, were not as helpful in processing my payment. Tone and manner of speaking was really offensive. ( I wonder why when they had such pleasing Manager). At arrival, they were not accommodating at all. The bellman and the other staff were the ones who entertained most of our queries. We even witnessed many misunderstandings with other guests, one even a tour group. They did not look very pleased with their bookings and the FD staff was nowhere near apologetic. I really do hope they sort of these two women (they look like college girls to me) at the front desk because that could have made the whole stay almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Only staynhere if younhave no choice”
Reviews.Author: HND007
Reviews.Content: The bell man smokes at the lobby, hotel staff and breakfast staff are unfriendly and unhelpful. The road construction will be there for another two to three years before they can complete the train route. When it rain, It's difficult if you travel with kids or senior citizens. Taxi drivers drop off pasenggers a few blocks from the hotel. Breakfast is good enough for this type of accommodation - nothing special just basic. The rooom is very clean; salute to the cleaners!

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly and Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AndyToh
Reviews.Content: Checked in 2 Double Rooms from 16 Dec t0 17 Dec 2011. The Hotel is reasonable clean with nice small pool at 2nd floor, but the Hotel Staff's service is worst of it's kind. The Receptionists and the Assistant Operation Manager presented their worst attitude and service anybody could give, totally unexpected. During check-in, the staff is totally not helpful in resolving my issues, and insist I can only check in 2 Adults for 2 rooms, and refuse to check in my other 2 guests, and insist of additional charges to be imposed, luckily it was resolved by my helpful agent. And the next day, the 4 guests were refused for breakfast and then clarified that the guests must proceed to counter to collect vouchers first, after wasting 20mins going up and down to searching all over the place. All these could have better manage with friendlier and helpful staff. Never stay there again, I am ashamed myself to be the resident of Singapore, and having this type of service quality encountered in the Country. I am sorry for all other people who has encountered similar experience as me.

Reviews.Title: “good location, basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: auds817
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Location is great, very accessible by MRT or bus. Room was clean and air-conditioning was cool. They have complimentary internet access. Short walking distance to Bugis market. I didn't really enjoy breakfast because they have limited choices and they served the same kinds of food in my entire stay. I would stay here again, not for the food, but because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Suitablefor a short stay”
Reviews.Author: 72Peter
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotelin May 2011 for 3 nights. Location was good for a ten minute walk to Bugis Market, or Bras Basah MRT. Breakfast was ok (althoughI pass on the chicken ham substitue for bacon -this just ruins the whole idea of breakfast for me.) Rooms are small as they all are in the moderately priced hotels in the large asian cities. Small convenience store across the road to the right of the hotel if you need drinks and snacks, is open late. If you turn left on bencoolen street and keep to the same side of the road as the hotel in 2-3 minutes you come across a nice little thai restaurant with great specials and right next door is a great dessert bar to cool off with.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_traveller_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 times over a 5 week period when passing through Singapore. The location is good as stated by other reviewers although on our last stay in early November the front of the hotel was behind barriers as the new MRT line will run under Bencoolen Street and construction is underway. The staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were small and on each visit the room we were allocated seemed to be smaller than the last. The bathrooms were modern and clean with only very basic toiletries.The air-conditioning is good and very welcome. On the second occasion we were in a room which had doors to the adjoining room presumably so that a family suite could be made. Unfortunately, the people in the adjoining room, who were not children, talked loudly for much of the night and we got very little sleep.There is a mosque or prayer house next door and this generates quite a bit of noise morning and evening. The breakfast is very poor not least as one is expected to sit on the pavement with pedestrians passing between the hotel and guests eating; it is also very hot to be eating outside. The wifi is very expensive SS12.00 per 24 hours which run continuously from when you start and only works in the guests rooms not in the foyer. Hotels rooms in Singapore are expensive especially by comparison to most of Asia but next time we will spend a bit more and be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DeepBan
Reviews.Content: Old hotel, small rooms but pleasant experience. Positives - 1. Reasonable room rates 2. Good location with taxi stand right in front, though Dhoby Ghaut station is a bit of a walk 3. Friendly staff - concierge to reception to housekeeping 4. Decent breakfast package 5. Got free internet since stayed for 7 nights 6. Cute swimming pool 7. 24X7 food court very close by Negatives - 1. Small rooms - cramped but clean 2. AC controls not user-friendly 3. Beds were too soft & small - got a back ache - even queen-size beds were not typical queen size May stay there again if alone but rooms too small for family. Service is really polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sojourner0907
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and we were not disappointed. It is about 200 meters from the Bras Basah MRT station and there's a bus stop nearby. Right across the hotel is a 7-11, and beside that a Kopitiam food court, a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf outlet, and a Wendy's. You'll never go hungry, that's for sure, although the bottled water at the nearby 7-11 is overpriced at S$1.80 and S$2.80 respectively, for what you can get at the mall supermarket at S$.40 and S$1. The surrounding area is well-lighted, very safe, clean and green, what with the Singapore Management University about a hundred meters away. Just next door or directly across are Bayview Hotel, Hotel 81, Strand Hotel and Rendezvous Hotel, which might explain the competitive pricing. We stayed for 3 nights for just over S$500 for each double and twin room, including breakfast and taxes. We had two de luxe rooms, both of them spacious enough for two occupants each--with a flat TV, an open wardrobe cabinet that also has the ref, the safety deposit box and the coffee service and electric kettle. There was also a dresser, and a bathroom that has enough room for a bathtub, a big sink with a mirror and marblelized counter and the water closet. Because guests had to use their Ving card to make the elevators move up, we felt very safe. The staff was courteous, prompt and efficient. We had requested for a higher floor, privacy, quiet rooms and windows in our online reservation and we got them all. The front desk also allowed us to check in at 10AM without us asking for it, and gave in to our request of a late check out at 1PM without too much fuss. The Filipino staff was just as generous in giving us tips on where to shop, how to use our MRT pass and get back our deposit, the best food outlets, etc. The minus points are for the absence of complimentary bottled water, the so-so breakfast that was the same during our 3-day stay and did not have refills of finished dishes, the very limited cable channels and poor TV reception, the malfunctioning Ving card, the small pool/spa, the cramped gym, and the skimpy toiletries--only one small soap disc at the sink, a small bottle each of shampoo and bath gel for the bathtub, and a travel toothbrush with a tiny toothpaste. But overall, it was value for money and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Junkeatarian
Reviews.Content: reading the previous reviews on trip advisor, we were expecting a small hotel with the bare basics in place. but when we reached the hotel, though the lobby gives a bad first impression, the service was excellent. the staff was extremely prompt and very helpful. the hotel had all the amenities that you would expect in a five star. the location was extremely convenient. Also, for two girls travelling alone, it was a safe place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Small (and not so clean) Rooms”
Reviews.Author: hapuchu
Reviews.Content: 3 Reasons to stay at Hotel Bencoolen: 1. Location - Near Orchard Road 2. Location - Very near Bras Basah MRT station 3. Location - Right opposite to a 24 hour open food court and Seven Eleven. 6 Reasons NOT to stay at Hotel Bencoolen: 1. Room was extremely small. It was like, you enter the room and jump onto the bed. We even checked out their 'larger' room (which was 50 S$ per night extra), but that too was pretty small. They have a family room (150 S$ per night extra) but that was just too big and expensive for the 3 of us. 2. We were charged 30 S$ for our 6 year old daughter; irrespective of that there was no place even on a floor for an extra mattress! 3. Hotel is pretty old (I think around 40 years) and was low on ventilation and light. There was this smell of damp air and cigarette smoke in the lobbies. 4. Carpets within the room were dirty and stained. 5. This hotel motivated us to go for sight seeing early in the morning and come back late in the night. 6. I am not commenting about the staff and service as it does not matter! I seriously suggest people reading this review to not go by the 'cheapest' listed rates and general reviews but inquire about the room itself. Looking back I feel that, in Singapore it is not important to stay in the city center as the MRT and bus connectivity is very good. Just make sure to stay near a MRT or bus station.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience in Singapore todate”
Reviews.Author: Yahava
Reviews.Content: The hotel smells damp, breakfast is the worst I have had in ages, rooms are basic boxes and I suggest you pay the extra $30 per night and stay at the Ibis up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Central location but poor service and room reeks of stale cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: sabaiwanderer19
Reviews.Content: Hotel : Central location within walking distance to Dhoby Ghaut MRT and City Hall MRT stations. Hotel has a swimming pool and a small basic gym (no free weights). Breakfast is nothing to shout about. Quick check in/out but reception staff are not friendly and appear disinterested. Room : Key card entry, average cleanliness with room still reeking of stale cigarette smoke. Smokers should know better than to smoke in an aircon room because the smell will stink up the room. That is why smoking is ban in all aircon areas in many countries. Ensuite with hot/cold shower, bath tub, comfortable pillows and mattress, TV, alarm clock, in room safe and mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely beds and pretty good room.”
Reviews.Author: Ckellygoddard
Reviews.Content: Not cheap for the mid-range standard that this falls in (I would say). Beds and bedding was lovely and room and bathroom (with bath) was pretty good. They charge for wifi - $6 for 24 hours I think. Borrowed the iron and ironing board but the iron leaked everywhere when I tried to fill it with water. Only a minor irritation though. Breakfast was good. Would probably stay again, definately if a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: WirungfromLombok
Reviews.Content: Stayed in other budget hotels in Singapore but this was the best especially if you get a good discounted price from Agoda, Clean and comforable rooms, not too small, okay Gym and good breakfast. Just beside Orchard road and one on the main train stations.

Reviews.Title: “close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: King1707
Reviews.Content: 3 stars hotel, you get what you paid for. clean room & bathroom. close to "kopitiam" food court, wendy's, 7/11 and others. there is a bus stop on Bencoolen street that will take you to Suntec (bus no. 857) or from Bras Basah Road bus stop, there are many bus route as well. (bus no. 36 & 111 take you to Suntec as well), Fare: $1 in Coin one way. Walking distance to Bugis Junction, CapitalMall, and others street vendors food. Room is small but ok as long as its clean. the bell boy and other staffs are helpful. Free breakfast serves early from 7am.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui_za
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in while our apartment was going through renovations. It is by no means the best hotel in Singapore but it fitted our budget and was right on the bus route leading to our work. This hotel is down town and so it's main drawcard is it's location. I would recommend it for people who don't mind staying in a very basic hotel with no frills. The carpets smell old and the elevator is old school so be prepared for that! Also you may have noise issues if you have an adjoining door with someone in another room who turns to TV up or is just noisy. We had to move roome because of this. Not all of the rooms are small like people say, ask to be moved if this is an issue. We moved to one of the smaller rooms due to noise issues (the smaller rooms don't have adjoining doors). It does have a small pool unlike most of the other hotels in it's class which is another reason why we chose it!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here (unless you're seeking dirt and rudeness)”
Reviews.Author: Nicksahk
Reviews.Content: What a place - it was fairly cheap, for Singapore, and I guess a lot of people stay here for either that reason or the location, but you get only a basic room and some of the worst service imanginable - rude, grumpy, surly front desk; shady porters; dishonest cleaning staff. Make sure you lock everything up, especially bags left at reception (check-in time is a strict 2pm, in itself not very good). The rooms are dirty, cleaned without care or enthusiam - best not to be walking around the room barefoot.

Reviews.Title: “Crap, too expensive and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: luissemanggi
Reviews.Content: I came there late. No choice. Unfriendly staff, no value for money, room not clean, noisy (karaoke or similar downstairs), no charm at all. I really don't recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: mokurene
Reviews.Content: cleanliness good. comfortable bed. very near to bras basah mrt,just few minutes walk will reach. nearby got kopitiam and 7-11 which operate 24hours so no worry on food.

Reviews.Title: “location great rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: shadur
Reviews.Content: i was satifiied with the hotel barely it could be better as in room size,i took the king solomon room with my wife and young infant son expecting some space,it had a king size bed but that is all it could fit in it.the refrigerator was on maximum cooling but nothing got chilled.the most annoying was that we booked the room and asked for a baby cot.when we arrived he told me there were none ,luckily the bed was large so he could fit in with us.on the positive its close to mrt ,24 hr kopitiam food hall and 7 eleven.breakfast was fine outdoors,usual buffet .pool was refreshing after a hot day of walking around,it is small though

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: ohmyg
Reviews.Content: The room is small, only enough for 2 people at max. Same as the bathroom, but they're nice and clean, the AC can only be turned on from the receptionist if you turned it off before. The breakfast is simple, but still good. Very suitable for travellers who don't spend much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JJnEE
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a nice budget hotel, Hotel Bencoolen definitely is the ideal choice! Clean room and reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, nothing to rave about service but in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: live÷e
Reviews.Content: Good for short stays, I was on a few hours of transit and didn't want to stay in the airport. Room was damp and in need of upgrade. Amenities are very basic, motel like. If you don't mind simple service, but in a great location, this would be a good choice! There are other motels around the same area too which are competitive in price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE ... REASONABLE PRICE .. no bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: edkhor
Reviews.Content: had a great x'mas week in s'pore recently and managed to get a family room with reasonable bathroom size here. overall very clean & secured hotel. free wifi access is great & hotel staff friendly. 4mins walk to the nearest mrt and 1bus just outside the hotel to go to orchard road, vivocity (sentosa) & simlim sq is just 5mins walk down the road. allowed my family to use the facilities to change & freshenup cos outgoing flight was midnite. sumptuous breakfast of sausages, eggs, omeltes, noodles, spagetti & fruits included in hotel room price. check out the pool ... its extremely cozy. and more importantly ... no bed bugs experience as reported earlier. thks ms kay & esther for the hospitality ... ed

Reviews.Title: “OK - NO REAL COMPLAINTS”
Reviews.Author: cultfigure
Reviews.Content: Functional, ok place which served the purpose of a 1 night stay en route to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs with bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: gdbkk
Reviews.Content: The first few days were ok - then I switched to a different room. Big mistake - it was infested with bedbugs which I didn't realize until the last night when I woke up. When I showed the hotel staff the next morning, their best offer was for $22 to have a health check. I thought it was outrageous at the price they charge that they couldn't come up with a better offer than that. I found one of the bugs and showed them. I had about 20 bites. When I got back I had to wash all my clothes immediately and keep my luggage outside to avoid transferring the bugs to my apartment. When I got back and called them to follow-up, they said they would agree to a partial refund and asked for my credit card - when I spoke with Agoda, they explained the hotel wouldn't need the credit card number, that Agoda would do the refund. In the end, they denied the existence of the bedbug and went back on their agreement to a partial refund. Anticipating that this might happen I took a photo and have reported the experience to the appropriate authorities alerting them of the health risks. The only thing I got from Hotel Bencoolen was itchy bug bites and worries about whether my home with a newborn baby is now infested with bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerful on the edge Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: scotts-tour
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked through adoga, checked in without problems. The rooms are great for tourists small, clean with hot showers. Breakfast is a buffet on the pavement/terrace in front of the hotel, great for watching the world go by. There is a franchise (name escapes me) modern food court just on the corner of the street. The hotel is located just 5 minute walk from Bugis junction and 2 mins from Dhoby Ghaut MRT. Once you familiarise with the geography its no more than 15 minutes walk from the waterfront, Raffles etc. I'd briefly considered spending bags of money by staying at Marina Bay, The Hotel Bencoolen was a fraction of the price, and I saw a whole lot more of Singapore. The Singapore Mass Transit (metro, underground) is fantastic, someone from London needs to look at it, see how an Underground system should work.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money place.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTCK
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in the downtown area. The price is very good for the location. The subway stations are close enough to walk. Besides that the hotel is decent. Stayed here for 1 night only but don't see myself coming back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DwTokidoki
Reviews.Content: Things I like about Hotel Bencoolen: 1. The strategic location - right in the middle of everything. - 1 bus ride away to Orchard Road. The bus stop is right across the street. - 1 bus ride back. The bus stop is half a block away - Near Bugis / Arab district - Near Marina Bay area (MRT ride away. MRT is just half a block away) 2. Value of money - rates are friendly even on "peak" season. 3. For that rate, the hotel is clean. 4. The room is small but not craped. 5. For a small room, the beds are queen sized. 6. Bathroom is clean. Water is fantastic (hot and cold) 7. The reception can speak English. 8. There's a aircon type hawker food stall across the street called "Kopi Tiam". It's open 24 hours. There's also 7-11 across the street. Dislike: 1. Well for the friendly hotel rate, breakfast food is simple. I went to Kopi Tiam to take breakfast instead. 2. The lobby has a funky smell. It's the smell of the carpet. Dont worry, the rooms doesnt smell like that. I would recommend this hotel to anyone of the following: 1. In a tight hotel budget. 2. Doesnt want to limit his travels within Orchard Area alone. 3. No frills on glamorous surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: BB_in_BJ
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect much from this hotel where we stayed for one night as a bridge for our Beijing-Singapore-Bintan trip. And we didn't get much. Breakfast was paltry and had to be served outside the hotel, on the sidewalk. Actually this we didn't mind that much, but the miniscule selection of eggs, ham and toast was a severe disappointment. The room itself was a decent size. Had better days. View? Side of another building and its ventilation equipment. Bathroom toilet had a plumming problem, took a long time for somebody (looked like a high school kid in street clothes) to come up to fix. The building itself has a small entrance akin to an old office building. Didn't feel very safe. Price wasn't too high, but next time I wil pay more to stay someplace decent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough for a short stay..”
Reviews.Author: Ainy_Nor
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a short one.. a 3days and 2nights stay.. just for the purpose of sitting an exam. My collegue and I booked this hotel together with our flight, so we did not know what to expect. We arrived early at 12noon, greeted by the not so friendly but helpful receptionist and discovered that the check-in time was supposed to be at 2pm. We were so grateful as we were allowed early check-in as there was available room at the time. The room was small but cozy. We were hoping for twin beds but got a queen bed instead. But we do not really mind. The room was well equipped with a bedside table, a rack to hang clothes enough for 2 people, a hairdryer, coffee/tea making equipments, a small fridge and a safe. The bathroom was also small but clean. Our room faced towards the bencoolen street and the window allowed us a nice view of the stone forest (yeah.. the buildings), the pool and the small garden. Yes.. the dome of the mosque was also obvious from our window. As we came in the month of Ramadhan and we were fasting, a simple guide from the receptionist made our search for 'halal' food for breaking fast easier. We went to the umm.. if we were not mistaken.. 'Al-Jailani' - an indian Moslem restaurant about a short distance away from the hotel, about 3minutes walk to the left of the hotel. It was convenient to be able to get 'halal' tasty food nearby as we do not have to go in search for good food elsewhere. Our business there was to prepare and sit for the exam, and the hotel suited us nicely for that purpose. We were also relieved to have the Bencoolen mosque just adjacent to the hotel and were able to get our Qiblat right as the receptionist has no clue as to what a Qiblat is. But we did not blame her as she herself is a non-Moslem. However, a tiny arrow in the room directing to the Qiblat (as what we have in hotels in Malaysia) would be a great help and a relief for us Moslem travellers. Our stay was purely for the exam. So we did not sample the pool or the gym provided there. But if it is for leisure in the future, will we be coming again to the hotel? I'd say yes..

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel with very unfriendly reception staffs”
Reviews.Author: jenjen2302
Reviews.Content: I was deeply and greatly disappointed with this hotel. When I first arrived with my family, the two female reception staffs did not even greet us with a smile. And when they tried to explain the hotel rules of extra charge of 30$ for my child, they conveyed it with a very unfriendly and almost impolite tone. Luckily, the manager of the hotel is reasonable enough to offer us with another option. This unfriendly way of receiving guest had really ruined my holiday mood and made my stay in that hotel very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jasonmums
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good location, room is everage with this price, but the reception staff service not friendly, breakfast also bad

Reviews.Title: “best price find in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: overseaswriter
Reviews.Content: Decisions, decisions...between a 5***** breakfast egg and a 3*** breakfast egg! For us 2 seniors it was easy! Beds at the BENCOOLEN HOTEL are excellent. We booked a room with 2 seperate beds and those "single" beds are pleasantly wide! We are not "sheet - and - blanket" tourists, we prefer simple douvets 'cause they are more hygenic. However the BENCOOLEN HOTEL sheets and blankets are pristine clean, actually the room is spotless too. Bathroom is spacious and clean, has a toilet which does not lean to one side and the toilet paper is velvet soft, like at home! There is a bath with clean shower curtains however we did spot some dark and missing grouting between the bathroom tiles. We had 2 bath towels each and 2 hand towels +1 bath mat. 1 tiny bar of soap, you use it and the next day you get a second bit of soap. There is 1 shower cap, 2 travel toothbrushes with toothpaste, shower gel and shampoo with conditioner. The room has enough hanging + flat cupboard space for 2 guests. The room comes with safe and coffee/tea making facilities and flat screen TV. Breakfast is a bit of a hassle and very basic, however it caters for Asians as well as Westerners. It is featured on the pavement, under cover. Next door is a bar/snooker hall where the BENCOOLEN guest can sit as well, however I would strongly recommend you try to sit outside! The BENCOOLEN staff is friendly and helpfull. Would we stay there again, yes, for sure because it is very, very central and right behind the Orchard Road. We paid RM240 including breakfast for 2 per night and we did not go hungry! Try NOT to stay at the BENCOOLEN over the weekend 'cause you'll find that it becomes very noisy. The BENCOOLEN has a small pool on the roof, no we did not "sample" that, we had enough to do and see!

Reviews.Title: “Room is ok, great location but the...”
Reviews.Author: mikaela_03
Reviews.Content: Room is ok, great location but the breakfast is so bad..

Reviews.Title: “Decent but pricey”
Reviews.Author: nshukla
Reviews.Content: The Hotel rooms were spacious, slightly old furniture but ok. Breakfast is served outside the main hotel on the foothpath and at adjacent pub. You have to fight out to get free internet. They give it if you insist, though it was part of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: dsierrab
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's not so bad, but the rooms smell bad: to humidity. The staff it's not too friendly, the breakfast is poor but enough. The best of the hotel is its location, it's a 1 block from Orchard av. and you can walk fron there to everywhere o take the SIA hop-on on the corner. Most of the websites said that you get free bottled water but is not true.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: frankspurs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location, I was originally only booked for 2 nights but when the Icelandic volcano ash closed all the European airspace, they kept me on a day to day basis for 5 nights at the rate I had booked through a discounter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hsio43
Reviews.Content: Very good service, free wifi in the room (but you have to get a username and password everyday). The room is nice, size is enough for us, LCD TV, Mini Ref, comfort room is nice. Hotel location is accessible to everything, there's some restaurants accross, 7-11, taxi stand. There's also a pool and gym in the hotel. Taxi from airport (afternoon) costs SGD22, but hotel-airport (early morning) cost only SGD13. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone, good price and location.

Reviews.Title: “delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: tigerpaws
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure I wanted to stay here after reading some of the reviews. We booked last minute for a great price and asked for connecting rooms. We arrived at 2am tired and hungry and were checked in right away. The connecting rooms were great and both had large bathrooms and tea and coffee making supplies. For a budget hotel the place was very clean and breakfast was served right outside early am and was more than adequate to start the day. Location is GREAT! Walk to Raffles Hotel for a Singapore Sling and Suntec City where you can get the Hop on Hop Off bus to everywhere. We missed the opening of the new Universal Studios but it looked great and ready to go. For price, location and breakfast, this is a little gem. Front staff not overly friendly, but with an easy to get around vity like Singapore, we didn't need much help. Also taxi rank is right in front of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place for a 'fussy' budget traveller!!”
Reviews.Author: Lakmade
Reviews.Content: Me and my best friend stayed at Hotel Bencoolen for six nights in Nov/Dec 2009, and it was an excellent stay. We had to change our hotel, since we were not happy with the original hotel we had booked on line from Colombo. We walked in to Bencoolen Hotel during our hotel search, and was immediately happy with what they had to offer. Location : Quite central and convenient. Walking distance to Orchard Rd, Little India and Buggis. There are a few Food Courts around, therefore you will not be out of options for food. Also, as it is the University area the area is very safe and you can even walk on the road late at night. The room was small, but was clean and cozy. The bathroom was spacious with a bathtub and extremely clean. Crisp linen and comfortable beds. They have a mini refrigerator and a closet in the room, helping you to keep the room tidy. The staff was nice, and very helpful. When they realized it was two young girls looking for a hotel, they were extra helpful. They understood our situation, and was quick to give us a solution. They in fact held on to the room (the only room that was available during a long weekend) till we checked out from our original hotel and got our luggage shifted to Bencoolen Hotel. They did this even with out a payment!! We only had breakfast from hotel and it was satisfactory. They can definitely better it by introducing a variety. It gets a bit boring if you are there for a long stay like us. However, if you are bored with the food, you only have to cross the road; and there's a Food Court serving different types of food. I have to write a very special mention about Aman, the doorman. He made our stay extra special, by greeting us every morning, in Sinhala - 'Ayubowan' :) He was concern and was keen to ensure our stay in Singapore was wonderful. He gave us tips on what to do, and where to go. Help us plan our days/places to visit etc., It was really nice to see a warm and smiling face when we come down for breakfast every day. THANK YOU AMAN FOR MAKING OUR STAY SPECIAL!! Overall, I would rate the hotel at 9 (on a scale of 1 -10, 10 being excellent) and will always have this as my 1st option when I visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Moccapasta
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Very close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT (only 10 minutes walk). Kopi Tiam food court and Seven Eleven convenient store located just across the road. The room is very small (I stayed in Family Room) - I think this is the minor part of the hotel but it is clean. Breakfast is very simple but good enough. Food served hot. Front Desk Staff lack of smile but they are helpful. The Uncle at the lobby is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cupert
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by mistake. Intended to book the Ibis but due to the late hour, I chose this hotel instead. Arrived with great trepidation which was overcome by the cosy atmosphere, clean and functional room. I would stay here again for the great location, the clean functional room and the price. Ok the breakfast is a bit basic but I am not particularly concern as I prefer to taste other food from the food stalls. I think some of the bad reviews I have read are a bit unkind. What does one expect for the price one pays. Would quite happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: JakartaSmiley
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager, Ms. Kay is very helpful when I called her for my reservation during Communic Asia's event. Our early check in time (12.00 am) for 10 (ten) rooms runs smoothly (thanks to the nice front office girl) and some rooms upgraded for free. The rooms were OK, just book for a King room or a twin room, their Elizabeth double is too small even for one person. Some bath room got bath tub and other got showers, they're all clean and in good condition. AC is good, bed sheet are clean and the housekeeping done a very good job tidying up my messy up room :P No cable TV are very dissapointing for the children in our group.. For the grown ups.. Well, we're busy with the convention, city tour and shoppings, so we didn't even had a chance to turn on the TV.. Great.. great location.. within 5 minutes you'll find Plaza Singapura.. walk another 10 minutes you'll ended up in Orchard Road.. Go to the opposite way Raffles City with lots of interesting places to see along the way. Love it! Breakfast on the pavement are OK, if you didn't like it, walk across the street you'll find a 24 hours Kopi Tiam. FYI, this hotel are 'clean' , they're not the kind of hotel, that put girls photos when nite falls.. Ugh.. Altough the hotel didn't offer you a lot, we're happy with the services given. We love this place so much, We'll planning to come again soon..

Reviews.Title: “Have booked another stay here in 6 months time”
Reviews.Author: krobar-oz
Reviews.Content: Nil disrespect but not sure what 'binzad' wanted - this place is clean, friendly, basic, cental etc, etc and breakfast cooked fresh al fresco on a pavement that you could almost eat your breakfast off - get the idea!! I spent an overnight here in 07/09 and have just booked 3 nights here in 01/10 - trying to take advantage of the graet exchange rate with the oz$/singa$ the staff here were gracious enough to take my late night call and arrange for immediate payment saving me $70oz - how's that for service?? this place is close to all amenities/the mrt [aka tube/metro] buses/ orchard rd - almostsmel the aromas from little india from the front door this has to be one of the best value for money digs in singapore - now that's a challenge for some-one to come up with better [current night fee is $90 oz dble with a/c] - beat that

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Binzad
Reviews.Content: Dirty place to stay. The rooms are really very small, i did not have space even to place my luggage, i had to place it on the cot and sleep beside the luggage, could not stay more than one night, so checked out immediately. The staff were also not at all co-operative. There is a 14" TV hanging almost at the ceiling height. If you watch it more more than 10 min, then u need to go for a neck therapy. Food is also very bad. There is not one reason why one should stay here. Over all this is the worst place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel that i ever been !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: samc_tf4_chen
Reviews.Content: First of all, the attitude of the receptionists ( a guy {not even wear their uniform} and a lady) is BAD!!!! The way they treat Asian and coucasion is TOTALLY DIFFERENT!!! The rooms were not clean ,smelly and noisy... They even said that NO VISITORS since we go there with our friends. THIS IS TERRIBLE!!!!!!! after that day we move to HOTEL 81 which next to this hotel...I RECOMMEND EVERYONE WHO LOOKING FOR BUDGET HOTEL, pls stay in HOTEL 81 as the service is better that BENCOOLEN HOTEL. ( For my experience, the most terrible thing is the staff come and check whether is there any extra ppl stay in our room and they even check whether there is other person hidding in the bathroom, sorry to say that [--]!!! ) when we complain to the reception, the GM cant even settle the complain. What i mean is she cant convince us why they done so and so. what she lastly said is just SORRY!! That's all... i will just say that NO SECOND TIME FOR ME TO STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic well run hotel in a good location - good for a layover”
Reviews.Author: Spahkee
Reviews.Content: We usually use Singapore as a city to transit out to explore other parts of South East Asia and so we don't expect to say at a property for more than 10 hours. In a city where hotel prices have skyrocketed, some of the nicer properties are exhorbitant given that for our needs, we're looking for a place to lay down our heads and eat a quick dinner or breakfast before transiting out. The Bencoolen Hotel meets our needs - due to the airplane arrival time coming close to 1am, we advised that we would be checking in early in the morning and they confirmed that they would hold our reservation. No problems at all with the taxi driver finding the hotel and efficient check in. Rooms are well kept but small. They have hot water and air conditioning, two of my basic needs and the beds feel just fine. Walking right out of the hotel and making a right, you'll come across a 24 hour indian prata place to slake your early morning munchies - get a couple of pratas, a mango lassi and spend the time acclimiating to Singapore. I'm not sure I'd recommend this property for more than a day or two since this is essentially a place to lay your head down, no more - but within walking distance, you can get to Bugis Junction with a ton of food choices and a taxi queue is right outside your hotel so no need to worry about having to call a taxi. Bottom line: the hotel met our expectations of a clean well run establishment to spend a couple of hours during our Singapore layover without breaking our budget. Location to good food and easy access to taxis made this especially nice. Down side: wouldn't recommend this to people looking to spend a lot of time in Singapore unless this is the only thing that your budget will allow. I can see this property becoming dreary over a couple of day period.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigal78
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant staying there due to reading previous reviews but we were pleasantly surprised how great our stay was. The rooms were on the somewhat tiny side but there was a make shift closet, big nice bathroom, and most importantly very clean! The staff was very nice and courteous! The only complaints I would have was that 1 of the lifts seem to be always broken, no room service (but great eateries very close), no laundry facilities (too expensive to go through them and none near by as well). May not stay at the hotel due to wanting to stay on Sentosa island on our next trip. But will recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: palmy62
Reviews.Content: The only good thing was the location! Terribly noisy, and things not working. Appeared reasonably clean but mice were seen in our room on last night of stay. Lights (card operation) wouldn't work; air-con controlled by office (either on or off) and no temperature control in room so either froze or cooked. No hot water one day. Breakfast?? No restaurant so this was served outside on the footpath. Hot food was not covered at all. Budget - yes - but not worth the hassle. Would have moved on if we hadn't pre-paid. Stayed a total of 6 nights spread over 2.5 weeks. Different room each visit, all equally disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but very basic”
Reviews.Author: tallsamoan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bencoolen is located less than a 10 minutes walk to either Orchard Road or Bugis Junction, which makes it centrally located and easy to get around. Lots of shopping & dining in every price category near-by. The room was the smallest I have encountered in my decades of travel, if you're claustrophobic, stay away. It was 7sqm, tops! Bathroom is small as well, but newly renovated. Water hot & pressure good., basic amenities are available. Only 2 English TV channels are insufficient.. My room faced a back alley, if you're a light sleeper the 3.30am garbage pick-up may be disturbing. The aircon blew right on the bed, there was no option but freezing or shutting it off entirely. Housekeeping & laundry was very good. There was an issue with the key cards as well, card insert was not marked with arrow so inserting it to activate the lighting/ electrical system was a puzzle every time. Entire wiring needs overhaul as some lights worked at times, some didn't, depending on the day. Breakfast "al fresco" curbside is a neat idea, however food & quality on offer was far below par. Pool deck cozy, but small. OK for a refreshing dip, though. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Certain staff smoke in the lobby but tell guests to go smoke outside!! No harm done, though. Due to a flight-delay I had to cancel my first night at the very last moment and was surprised that I was NOT charged for it, which I sincerely appreciate!! Overall, if you just need a clean place to crash in a great location, Hotel BC may be an option. For travelers expecting a little extra, there are better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Would try another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: AndreasForever
Reviews.Content: I stayed at standard twin room (elisabeth queen type} and paid SGD 103 per night on 20 & 22 March 2008. The room is shocking small, there is no chair due too limited space. The room is adequately clean while the bathroom somewhat clean. Furniture is old, and amazingly you can only switch off the AC (fan level and tempature are not function). And to switch on the AC again, you have to call receptionist. Housekeeping is closed on 19.00 or 20.00 so you cannot request anything after that. Receptionists are not friendly even rude sometimes. Concierge men are friendly and helpfull (but i don't think the boy). There are no swimmimg pool only jacuqzi pool. Room is quite and sometimes cold (temp button doesn't work). Near douby ghout and city hall MRT, 5 minutes walk. Overall is OK for 1 night (max 2 nights) stay but I will look for another hotel next time

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: nicall
Reviews.Content: Smallish but comfortable bedroom. Wireless internet available (though over-priced). Charming and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Happy that we could check-out early”
Reviews.Author: TripReit
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels in the city centre near Ochard road. We had to pay about 100 euro a day for the room, but the value of the room is not worth the money. The rooms were not clean, the boy at the check-in was very unfriendly and the equipment in the room was very outdated (including the not functioning a/c). We where very pleased that the hotel's swimming pool was closed, this provided us a good reason to look for another hotel near Singapore. We found one on Sentosa Island which was the same price and a real winner!

Reviews.Title: “Overall is good if you are travelling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ajnone
Reviews.Content: Bencoolen St is situated within 10~15 minutes walk to Orchard Rd. I stayed in a twin sharing room on the 7th floor. The room was quite large, enough for couple and wth a well equipped bathroom.It is clean and quiet too. Staffs are friendly enough except for the front receptionist (female). Overall is good if you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: We got a reasonable deal at S$168 per ni and were there for 2 nights last week. The first night we arrived at around 11pm and were given Room RS6 on the 2nd floor. It was a nightmere - notwithstanding its new decor, the room was absolutely unbearably noisy. (I can assure you I am NOT a light sleeper.) You can hear every single movement concerning toilet flushing, people taking showers and washing hands ALL NIGHT LONG. I think this has something to do with the interior design of the piping. The fact that this room is located on the 2nd floor may be part of the reasons for the non-stop toilet activities - you get 10+ bathrooms above you! The first thing we did the next morning was to ask for a room change. The very helpful front desk staff did so almost immediately, making me curious if this is an ongoing problem with the room, or all rooms on the second floor. Anyway, we moved to another room on the 3rd floor. This room apparently is more tired and is not yet renovated. (An old bathtub rather than a shower room .) But this is like a gem to us already (because we can hear no more toilet flushing). My conclusion is unless you get earplugs and prefer new decor to good sleep, stay away from RSX (2nd floor) rooms. The room issue aside, I find the location and breakfast very staisfactory indeed.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: karen11au
Reviews.Content: For aminimal price this Hotel was fine for a short stay. Breakfast was included and the area was fine.I felt very safe on my own. The room was tiny ,but clean and air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: vegasuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and loved it so much cut our holiday in melaka short by 1 night to re visit the hotel again. Great location. Near orchard road, raffles and little india. We had a king size room which was nice and big. Even had a duvet. ( which i loved) My husband loved the light and main door gadgets. Breakfast was good and served on pavement. Which caused no problems

Reviews.Title: “relaxed ,pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: oziehenk
Reviews.Content: friendly helpfull staff central location value for money small but adequate rooms facilties provided are good just booked to stay here again recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in expensive Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DaveHK
Reviews.Content: Bencoolen St is situated within 10 minutes walk to Orchard Rd in one direction and Little India in the other and as such is close to two of the reasons to travel to Singapore. I stayed in a twin room on the 5th floor. The room was quite large as twins go, with a well equipped bathroom. The shower is in the bath but has good water pressure and heating. The beds are king size singles. The room has TV, internet access (wireless) although that feature is very expensive and hard to connect to. $5 per hour from the time you sign on or $25 /day. It is not possible to pay onto your room account (cash at counter only) and so you have to make a trip to the reception to get connected. There is another coin operated Internet Kiosk in the foyer area for those without wireless. The TV is remote controlled for convenience and the lights are controlled from beside the bed. A small desk and mirror, standard hanging space, coffee making facilities (no tea) and be careful, the whitener supplied also contains sugar (so its sweet or black - no choices there). The TV has limited channels in English and no video/dvd option so don't count on sitting back and relaxing in front of the box. The staff are friendly enough - but only just - something not quite right but couldn't pick what it was. The taxi booking system to the airport is a rip-off (sort of like the internet service). Charged at $28 pre booked. I left for the airport at 4.30am but walked outside to see a cab rank and 5 taxis sitting doing nothing. Average cost for taxi to airport from the airport to the hotel is $18. There is a good selection of well priced restaurants, clubs and bars within walking distance. This place represents good value for Singapore. It is clean and quiet too. Breakfast is included in the tariff served outside on the sidewalk between 7.30am and 10am. This is a nice touch in the tropics. The breakfast is bacon, fried eggs, baked beans, toast, tea and coffee, orange juice and various jams etc. Help yourself buffet style. I paid $128 per night although the advertised price was $108 for the room. In Australia or New Zealand you would pay between $60 and $80 for the same standard of services and facilities - hope that helps. Don't get your hopes up but you won't be dissappointed. Good choice if you are travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and central”
Reviews.Author: NorthWestLondoner
Reviews.Content: Due to getting a bit too relaxed about finding accommodation while in Australia, I arrived in Singapore without anywhere to stay. This was a mistake, because the more budget hotels were filling up fast. Having noted down a couple of good Tripadvisor reviews, I bagged a room at Bencoolen hotel. The room contained a double bed and a single bed, a writing desk area, a TV, a fridge, air con (with temperature control, but if you turned it off, you had to approach reception to turn it back on), tea and coffee making facilities and a mini safe. The bathroom had an overbath shower with very good pressure, towels, and some free toiletries. After the first night, I had to change rooms, as this room was booked up by someone else. I moved to a similar King sized (more expensive) room. The facillities were the same. Breakfast was included, and is OK, although nothing special. There are 2 types of juice, some watermelon, beans, fried eggs, noodles, toast, and cornflakes. There is one coin fed computer with internet in reception. I slept very well in both rooms, and heard very little noise from the corridor or other rooms. Housekeeping made up my bed and cleaned the bathroom every day after 12. When I had a problem with a plug being stuck in my room, reception immediately sent someone to sort it out. Reception was always very friendly, and helpful. They put my luggage in secure storage after I checked out, in order that I could go sightseeing for the day. There were a few small maintenance issues that would have made it a first class room - there was one socket loose, and a couple of small rips, or marks on the wallpaper. The lights, bathroom fan and a couple of other things were controlled by a control panel by the bed, but the pictures on some of the buttons had worn away, making it a hit and miss affair as to weather I was switching off the lights, or asking reception to send up housekeeping. Hopefully, the hotel will keep on top of these signs of wear and tear, so that it continues to be a good value quality option in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “affordable hotel with nice pool”
Reviews.Author: NZConny
Reviews.Content: As a family with 7yr old child and 7 month old baby we have just spent 2 nights at the Bencoolen. We paid around SGD140 per night for a room with a double bed and a kingsize single bed. We were not sure whether there would be a cot available for the baby but when we saw the room we didn't even bother to ask as there was no room for it. It was called a family room but was really small. Otherwise the bedroom and bathroom were nice and clean, the staff very friendly and helpful, especially the porter, and the rooftop whirlpool was wonderful (although the term rooftop is a bit misleading - it is on the 2nd storey and has no views). The only negative thing was the noisy and very cold airconditioning which was centrally controlled so couldn't be turned off and on by us. Locationwise is was good too, less than 10 min. walk to the metro, bus stops around the corner and Orchard Road, Little India and other points of interest in walking distance. Would most likely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bencoolen
HotelInfo.Address: 47 Bencoolen Street, Singapore 189626, Singapore
